inlineContent.text: This tutorial will help you to understand SettingsScreen API easily
This Section tells you how to import library
Open View controller where your are going to implement SettingsScreen
Import SettingsScreen module
Create settings view controller configuration
Create settings view navigation controller and present it.
It is base code that you need to present SettingsViewController
This Section tells you how to add Section to SettingsScreen
Continue previous code
Add new section to configuration
On this step you can add Section Header and Footer. If you need to add table view with
style, don’t add header and footer to sections, and set to configuration
table view style by method `.tableStyle(_:)
This Section tells you how to add Cells to the sections
Continue previous code
Add switch cell by method
to the first section with default state.
To add action to switch cell you can use closure with.
returns changed switch state.
Let’s add cell with detail label. You can do it with method
Let’s add cell with checkmark. You can do it with methods
and
. In the closure you can add actions that will be executed when cell state changes.
This section tells you how to create cells which move you to another screen
Start our code without previous cells
First of all we have to create another settings view controller with configuration.
Then we create Disclosure cell by method
, and set there our
Result should be like on the video
Another case when we would like to see our choice in the cell. We can use cell with disclosure and detail text.
This type of cells works only with screens having
Let’s create different second screen with selectable section with only one selected item.
Let’s add another type of cell with disclosure. You can do it by method
. Be careful because ViewController must conform to
protocol.
already conforms to, but keep it in mind if you’d like to create your own View Controller.
By default detail title shows you cell title from the second screen configuration.
If you would like to handle selecting on the selectable section, you have to set closure to whole section. Closure returns you index of the selected cell.
Let’s see our results
This section tells you how to change style of the SettingsScreen
Let’s start with several plain cells

To change checkmark tint color in

If you don’t need to set different colors for switches and checkmarks, you can use method

that set tint color for navigation bar element, switches and checkmarks. Be careful if you accent color is not the same with switches and checkmark. In this case firstly you have to set accent color and then change switch and checkmark colors.
